inn1.comm: quicker one that slides back in from round the stumps, he gets forward and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
leans forward and offers a dead bat to the one coming in
pushed through quicker on middle, eased down the pitch
firmly driven, but straight to cover
touch short on middle, punched to the cover fielder at the edge of the circle
tucked to the midwicket fielder.  Maiden over to start with
shapes away from outside off, driven wide of mid-off
bit of swing in the air again, bowled fuller, inviting Moor to drive, no movement of the feet as he looked to drive, beats the edge by a whisker
play and a miss again. Looks to drive on the up past cover, but fails to account for the late swing away.
solidly defended off the front foot to cover
gets forward and taps it to the off side
floats it at length on middle, tucked to the on side. Good follow-up over to Hamza's first
quicker one on middle, bunted back to the bowler
sharp turn away, he looks to step out to drive, changes his stroke. Defended back to the bowler

there's the breakthrough. It slides back in from wide of the crease from round the stumps, Chibhabha looks to play across the line off the back foot, but the ball rushes back in to hit him on the pad. Umpire Shamsuddin had no doubts whatsoever on that one. That ball would have crashed in to middle and leg. Easy decision that
gets a good stride forward and defends
another slider, a touch fuller this time, pushed to mid-off
hit on the pad but the ball was sliding down leg
looks to drive, gets a thick edge that runs down to third man
thumped off the front foot, covering the late swing to drive, but straight to cover
shapes away from middle, it was angled in well and Masakadza looked to flick initially, but changed his stroke at the last moment, ball rolls off the leading edge to the off side
can't pierce the off side ring, driven straight to mid-off
on middle and leg, whipped away nicely into the gap at midwicket, off the mark with two
special stroke. Sprays it full and on middle, looks for the late swing away but there was none and Masakadza played a delightful on-drive that beat the diving mid-on fielder.
some excitement, but the ball lobs off the pad, wide of short leg
low full toss on middle, driven to long-on
steps out and flicks it to wide long-on
the arm ball that comes back in from wide of the crease, punched to the off side
cuts it straight to backward point
slows that one down, grips the surface and spins away slightly, dabbed to the off side
half-volley outside off and he has smashed that through extra cover. Good, clean swing. Excellent timing, proper balance and it races away into the boundary
short on middle, rides the bounce and pulls it into the gap at deep fine leg
length ball outside off, left alone
excellent leave. Floats it at length on off, Masakadza expected that to leave him but this one came back in, went over the stumps. Very, very close
excellent stroke that. Whipped off his hip through square leg, poor effort from the fine leg fielder. Got the dive in, but couldn't get down to the ball in time
watches it through to the wicketkeeper
dabbed to the off side
hit through the line, lofted cleanly over mid-off, one bounce into the boundary
gets forward and taps it with soft hands
tucked to midwicket
sliding down leg, punched to deep midwicket
swept superbly behind square on the leg side, no one moved.
watches it through to the keeper
wild swing at that one, nowhere near him, pitched outside off and swinging away, beaten
gets a good stride forward and taps it to the off side
looks to slap that over mid-on, bat nowhere near it
back of length ball on middle, defended down the pitch
thumped over cover, not a half volley but he went on the up and good enough bat on it to clear the leaping fielder there
angles a full ball on middle, defended
full on off, defended to cover
back of length delivery on middle, bunted back to the off side
walks across but is cramped for room, Ashraf bowls it just around off, played back down the pitch
looks to slog across the line, but lets it go eventually
can't pierce the off side ring, straight to cover
looks to work it to the on side, but turned the bat face a little too early, played back to the bowler
drive and a miss. Wasn't there to play the stroke, done in by the late movement away
low full toss on the pads, superbly flicked between midwicket and mid-on, urgency in the running as well
half-volley on off, thumped hard to Stanikzai at cover. He starts celebrating thinking it was a catch, but Masakadza clearly hit it onto the ground. A bit of confusion. Correct decision made
beaten by the one that swings away from outside off, feet nowhere near the pitch of the ball

that was round the corner. Got the feeling he was itching to go after him, connects cleanly this time. Too full on off, Masakadza swung cleanly, enough elevation to carry it all the way down the ground
whipped into the gap at midwicket, Hamza mops it up
appeal for lbw but the ball was sliding down leg
turns it to Mohammad Nabi at midwicket
picks the length early and smashes that in front of square into the deep midwicket boundary. Bread and butter stroke. Sitting up nicely for him to play the stroke
punched to mid-off for a quick single, Stanikzai was a little slow to react
hit back down the ground, bounces over the bowler's head, quick single taken again
check-punches the stroke past the bowler, easy single in the end

goes over cover and he's smashed that over the ropes. Didn't look like it came off the middle, but the power he generated with the swing took it all the way. A leap from the fielder there, but he was 10 yards inside. Had he been at the ropes, would've been an easier catch. This one just bobbles out as he fell on his back side
hops across and turns it to mid-on for a quick single
short of length outside off, punched to cover
whipped across the line, a misfield by the mid-on fielder gives them the extra run
another misfield, this time by Stanikzai at cover, it was thumped hard, he ran in too early
flicked towards deep midwicket
slow turn from outside off, played back to the bowler
punched off the back foot to deep cover
taps it wide of point
the wrong-un this time, Moor failed to read, shaped to cut and got a thick edge to third man
tossed up over his eye-line, he plays it down to long-on
waits for it to spin back in, nudged to deep midwicket
attempts a reverse-sweep, can only play it as far as point
gets forward and blocks
steps out and turns it with the spin to long on
nicely looped on off, turned to midwicket
gets to the pitch and eases it to cover point
short and he has hammered that into the deep midwicket boundary. Rocked back and slapped that over midwicket. Couple of bounces into the ropes
stroked to deep cover
wrong-un on middle, punched back to the bowler
can't get the elevation, toe-ends a pull, lands short of midwicket
defended to point
beaten by the googly again, gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
punched between midwicket and long-on
steps out and plays it down to long on
short outside off, he makes room and punches it towards cover, one bounce to the fielder
deceived in flight, lunges forward but fails to account for the one that skids on, misses the edge by a whisker
good drive but straight to cover
shortish delivery spinning back into middle and leg, turned wide of square leg
short on off, played to the point fielder
slaps it to long on, wanted to hit it over midwicket
beaten on the drive. Stretches forward but can't get to the pitch as he looked to go over
high full toss outside off, he gets across, takes it on the full and sweeps it into the vacant square leg region, no one there
short outside off, he rocks back and across, lines himself up and pulls it over deep midwicket. Muscular blow that. Picking the length early. Doesn't need a second invitation for such deliveries
short on off, punched to cover
gets forward and turns it to short midwicket
punched wide of the diving cover fielder
just eludes midwicket. He steps out but didn't get to the pitch of it, went through with the flick and just managed to clear the fielder.  31st ODI fifty for Masakadza
gets a thick inside edge to the on side
slow turn back in from outside off, driven to cover
tucked to short midwicket
punched past the bowler to long on
width on offer, opens his wrists and eases it wide of point, towards the boundary rider there
dabbed down to the third man fielder
excellent stop by the cover fielder, diving full length to his left to stop that back foot punch
gets a leading edge, no damage done, rolls to cover
tucked to midwicket, end of another quiet over
gets forward and defends
cuts, but the point fielder is caught napping as the ball bursts through his fingers. How expensive will it prove to be?
driven down the ground to long-on
beaten by the slider. Pitches outside off and skids on, he played for the turn
punched back to the bowler, he can't collect it cleanly, rolls to long-on
rocks back and plays it down to long-off
slow leg-cutter on middle, played across the line to wide long-on
cramped for room, tucked to midwicket
angled into middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket
back of length on middle, punched down to long on
slower one on off, check-drives that one to mid-off
angled into middle and leg, nurdled to short fine leg
tossed up on middle, driven down the ground to long-on
turned down to long-on, 100 up for Zimbabwe
fired in full on middle, played back to the bowler
on the shorter side, he whips that wide of midwicket
cramped for room, played back to the bowler
eased back down the pitch
angled into middle from wide of the crease, pushed to midwicket
eased down to long on for an easy single
leans forward and dabs it to cover

frustration has got the better of him. It was a length ball on off, not much pace on it, Moor looked to go over mid-off but it turned out to be a flat hit as Noor Ali completed a good low catch. Once again, Moor wastes a good start
is squared up a touch as he looked to defend it to the off side, gets enough bat on it, so no damage done
defended to mid-off again
stretches forward and eases it behind the wicket on the off side
yorker-length, can't get underneath that, squeezed back to the bowler
short ball and he has swung that across the line into the midwicket boundary. Dragged it too short and Masakadza latched onto it in a jiffy
works it down to long-on
full toss outside off, slapped to deep midwicket, the fielder does well to get around quickly
lands the googly outside off, punched back to the bowler
gets a thick inside edge as he looks to drive, rolls to long on
short and angling in to middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket

Shahzad puts down a sharp chance . He looks to defend, gets a thick edge as he's squared up, the wicketkeeper grabbed at that one, the fact that he was standing up to the stumps didn't help either, goes down.
sprays it down leg, easy call for the umpire, another fumble by Shahzad
nicely behind the line of the ball, played back down the pitch
gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
mistimes an attempted punch back to the bowler, done in by the slowness of the delivery and perhaps even the surface
drifting into middle, defended
little bit of air, sharp turn away, he prods forward tentatively, beaten
slog sweeps that to deep midwicket
gets a good stride in as he smothers the spin
frees his arms and slaps it down to long-off
walks across and tucks it to short midwicket as they scamper through for a quick single
the square drive is played straight to the point fielder
lofts it over mid-off, didn't get it off the middle as the ball bounces twice before the boundary. He looked to hit it a lot straighter, but no damage done. Boundary  nonetheless
sensibly done, hits a boundary and then bunts one to long-off for an easy single
slower one on middle, punched to long on
slower one on middle, eased to long on
eased past the bowler to long-on again
tossed up on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
steps out but can't get to the pitch, blocked
leading edge caused by the slow turn and grip off the surface, just short of cover
fired down leg, Shahzad collects cleanly as Mutumbami misses, stifled appeal but no says the umpire
slow turn away, trifle short as well, he rocks back, makes room and slaps it past the diving cover fielder, super hit
gets to the pitch and flicks it across the line to deep midwicket
turns the bat grip to reverse sweep it past short third man, can't get the gap

fetch that, he says. What a welcome to the bowling crease. Bowls a gentle loosener, right in the slot outside off, Mutumbami swings through the line, excellent use of the bottom hand as he gets the elevation. Over the deep midwicket boundary. He's batting with plenty of purpose. There's an air of confidence too
excellent drive down the ground to Rashid Khan at long-on
overpitched outside off and he's caressed that between cover and mid-off, delightful timing
full on middle and leg, worked to long on
solid punch but a good stop at point
slower one on off, runs it down to third man

sees the ball tossed up over his eye-line, comes down on it very quickly and smashes that out of the ground. Gets down on one knee, goes over midwicket and connects it off the middle of the bat. They've asked for a new set of balls.
doesn't matter how they come. Shapes to cut, gets a thick edge but it flies past short third man, no chance for the fielder. Wheels are coming off for Afghanistan
looks for the delicate dab, misses.
opens the face and plays it to point
skids on after pitching outside off, plays and misses
some bite off the rough, extra bounce as well, doesn't miss the gloves by much. Good end to the over
punched back past Rashid's outstretched right hand, down to long-on
eased to point, slow turn away again
slices that one over point, he looked to go over cover but the ball turned and he didn't get to the pitch entirely, lucky escape
eased to point
excellent googly, he shaped to play the one that turns away but this one came back in sharply, managed to jab his bat down in the nick of time
fires that one outside off, turns after pitching, beaten on the drive
pushed through on off, played to cover
gets forward and defends, looks like he's eyeing the deep midwicket fence
good stop off his own bowling
whipped wide of midwicket
shorter one on middle, makes room and bunts it down to long on
done in by slow turn, ball deflects off his thigh pad to short fine leg, they scoot across for a quick single
full on off, played to cover
gets forward and plays it with soft hands to the off side
beaten by the slog, hit on the pad courtesy the googly which he failed to pick, big appeal. Umpire reckons it would have bounced over
gets forward and smothers the spin nicely
prods forward, thick inside edge to backward square leg
looks to go over cover, can't get to the pitch, swung early too
gets to the pitch and works it back to the bowler, good stop
defended to short midwicket
can't get to the pitch again, blocked with soft hands
makes room and slaps it straight to the cover fielder
shapes to sweep, can't get down on his knees properly, just manages to get some bat on it towards square leg
driven hard back down to long on
sharp turn from the rough, picks the googly, waits inside the crease and defends
turns the bat face early to flick, rolls to cover
flicked with the angle this time to deep midwicket
can't get hold of the pull, down to deep midwicket
full toss outside off, he finds the gap this time between deep square leg and deep midwicket. Poor ball, all the time in the world to hammer that anywhere he wanted
covers the line of the ball, eased back to the bowler

a wicket at the right time for Afghanistan. Mutumbami perishes to the slog sweep. Looks to fetch it from outside off, ends up dragging it straight to the fielder at deep midwicket. As easy as they come
gets forward and taps it to cover
rolls off the inside edge to the on side
lobs off the flap of the pad to the leg side
hit hard, back to the bowler, good stop
steps out and works it to the midwicket region, excellent stop again
worked across the line to midwicket
can't get to the pitch, offers a straight bat
tucked to the leg side, beaten in the air as he looked to go for a slog sweep
walks across and taps it to the on side for a quick single, both keeper and bowler ran towards the ball, couldn't prevent the run

angles in from wide of the crease, lands on middle and goes on with the arm, Masakadza is rapped on the pad as he looked to play to the on side, umpire Shamsuddin indicates it would have missed leg,  excellent decision
steps out to whip, hit on the pad but he was miles outside the crease
makes room and cuts it straight to point
gets a thick outside edge towards point
steps out and defends it to point
waits for the slow turn back in, dabbed to point
gets a thick edge that runs down to short third man, they scamper through for a single
rolls his wrists on that and whips it wide of the midwicket fielder
floats it full on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as it rolls back down the pitch
reverses back in from length on off, defended
opens the face of the bat and eases it to point for a quick single
walks across the stumps and tucks it wide of midwicket
excellent bouncer on the body, pacy one too, Chigumbura manages to avoid it in the nick of time
spinning down leg, keeper fails to collect but short fine leg runs in quickly, wide called
punched wide of cover for an easy single
spins back into middle, played back to the bowler
pushed through quicker on off, the ball drifts in a touch, pitches and skids on, he pushes outside the line of the ball and is trapped plumb in front of middle.
nearly lobbed back to the bowler again
stays inside the crease and defends to the on side
gets to the pitch and works it to long on, off the mark
reverses back in from outside off, he's behind the line of that one
almost chopped back on, stands tall to punch, gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg
banged in short outside off, he was in two minds, wanted to pull but let it go in the end
another good bouncer, this time the slower one, Masakadza pulls out of the hook
looks for the yorker, turns out to be a low, slow full toss, flicked to deep midwicket
plays the short-arm jab towards deep square leg
drops it into the off side with soft hands for a quick single
swept to short fine, they attempt a risky single, just manage to finish it. Had Masakadza missed it, he would have been trapped lbw
risky single to short fine leg
dabbed to the off side, can't get to the pitch
pushed through quicker on middle, played back to the bowler

backs away, frees his arms and slaps it into the gap at deep cover, the fielder runs around the ropes, dives across the turf to pull it back. The full-length stretch helped pull the ball back, but the point to consider was if his body was touching the line as he pulled it back. Looks like he's fine. Multiple TV replays can't present a clear picture on that occasion. Full marks for the effort nonetheless
he's picked the bones out of that one. Short outside off, he rocks back and pulls it in front of square, couple of bounces into the deep midwicket boundary
uses the pace of the bowler and runs it down to third man
mistimes a pull to midwicket

he has muscled that one over deep midwicket! When he hit it, didn't look like it would travel that far, but it just kept sailing. Picked the length early and got it over the ropes quite easily. Seemed like he was waiting for it, generates tremendous bat speed
low full toss on the pads, misses a faint tickle, deflects off the pad to the on side
runs it down to third man
steps out but can't get to the pitch, pads it away
slogged across the line from well outside off, towards deep midwicket
plays the half-pull to long on
tucked across the line towards midwicket
picks the length early and eases it down to long-on
swept behind square for an easy single
that is a massive hit. No full flourish, just a whip/half-pull and he gets enough on it. Using the depth of the crease to good effect as it sails over deep midwicket
smacked wide of cover, good stop by Hamza
excellent yorker-length delivery, tails back into middle and leg, squeezed to deep square leg
half-volley outside off, he makes room and carves it behind point, excellent placement
high full toss on middle, nudged past the bowler to long on
spears in a good yorker on middle, he digs it out but can't get the single to keep strike
turned wide of the vacant midwicket region, bowler does well to get across to stop

swept across the line, he's haring back for the second and they manage to complete it in the nick of time as Raza dives to get back in at the non-striker's end.  Fourth century for him . He's pumped, as he should be. Points to the Zimbabwe crease and then towards the dressing room. This is a big knock at a time when his team needed it badly
tucked behind square on the leg side

steps out to slog that out of the park, but can only hit the high full toss as far as the long off fielder. He was far outside the crease when he made contact, so that can't be a no-ball. The umpires are checking anyway. It's fine. The ball was dipping. But he's played an important hand
chipped back over the bowler's head to long off
wrong-un on off, dabbed to short third man
yorker length outside off, looks to squeeze it behind point, can't jam his bat down in time
drilled to long-off
that is a superb yorker, the batsman was moving around too much, in the end, looked silly as he was cramped for room as that swing of the bat came down after the ball had cannoned into the stumps
he's hit flush on the shoulder as he looks to evade that pacy bouncer
punched back to the bowler, who deflects it off his boot to cover as he looks to stop it
a misfield at cover allows the quick single
picks the length early an swings it across towards wide long-on, good work in the deep
gets to the pitch of the ball, and boom! Lofted up and over, into the sight screen. Risk-free cricket at it's best. Didn't look to swing across, a conventional stroke and he got the best result

looks to go over cover, ends up slicing it to point, easily taken. This one dipped on him a little, was beaten in the air, he didn't lean into the stroke, head was nowhere in position as he looked to hit this one over the top. End of a terrific innings
gets across the line to work it to midwicket, rolls back to the bowler instead
swung across to the on side, splits the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
mistimes a pull towards deep backward square, the fielder there was moving very slowly, late to react as well, back for the second easily
superb bouncer, angles it on middle from wide of the crease, Jongwe shapes to pull but is done in by the pace of it, just manages to avoid it

can't scoop it behind, ends up yorking himself, the keeper fires in a throw but they squeeze through for a single, wasn't too far from the stumps. Had the keeper's hit disturbed the stumps at the striker's end, Cremer was gone
slapped over the infield, the long-off fielder, who should have taken it on the bounce, misfield and parries the ball ovee the ropes, got a bad bounce but no excuses for missing that
slower one on middle, swung to deep square

pacy bouncer, Jongwe tied to pull but was done in by pace, went through with the stroke, got enough wood on it to fly over fine leg, but the problem is he happened to step onto the stumps. So the six doesn't count, he's out hit-wicket instead. Quite unfortunate, but credit to the bowler for steaming in and hurling them in at a good pace
squeeze through for a single, would have been another run-out had the throw from the point fielder hit direct at the non-striker's end
steps out and hit it inside out to Nabi, who dives and stops that one at extra cover, more importantly, Cremer is back on strike
fired into middle, mistimes a lofted hit to long on

gives him the charge but nowhere near the pitch as the ball was fired in, swung across the line, missed it but Shahzad collected it cleanly and whipped the bails off quickly. Madziva didn't even try to get back
swung north, ball goes south, deep cover runs in quickly to prevent the second

short outside off, he walks across and swings it towards the longer boundary at deep midwicket, didn't get hold of it, Shafiqullah runs in, somehow misjudged it as the ball was swirling away, he then had to dive to his left, which he did, to pull it off inches from the ground. Excellent catch that brings an end to the innings

inn2.comm: full on middle, swung across the line, gets a thick inside edge to mid-on
angled into the pads, tucked wide of square leg
superb flick shot. Half-volley on the pads, worked away towards deep square leg
sprays it down leg, loses control as he tries to swing it late from middle
angles it closer to the stumps this time, solidly defended
full and straight on off, played back down the pitch

delightful stroke. Not that bad a delivery, it was floated on middle. The only fault, if you could find one is that it was a touch fuller, and he flicked it superbly into the gap between midwicket and mid-on. Super wrist work
dabbed back to the bowler
quicker one on off, defended to the off side
tossed up outside off, he crashes that into the cover boundary. Couldn't resist the temptation of going after that half-volley
uses the pace and runs it down to short third man
skids back onto middle, he was hurried into a defensive stroke, takes the inside edge, flies to short fine, just missed the leg stump
played to Sikander Raza at midwicket
cuts and misses, a little too full to play that stroke
lovely drive to mid-on, too full and straight, he timed it well
fetches it from outside off, lofted over the infield, the mid-on fielder runs back to stop it, didn't time it well
excellent stroke! Not all that short, but he hops back and across and whips it away into the square leg boundary.
driven down to mid-off
too full and he's dispatched that without a fuss. On the pads, and Shahzad will pick those away even in his sleep
short outside off, cracked away to the point fielder
slides into middle, pushed back to the bowler
gets forward and taps it back to the bowler
worked across the line to long on
fired down leg, he sweeps and misses, excellent take by Mutumbami
fired into middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
lucky to get away with that. Short and angling in, he tucks it to short fine. A metre on either side and it would have been four
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
half-volley on middle, firmly driven but straight to mid-on

straight as an arrow. Delightful to see a top order batsman play such strokes. Presents the full face of the bat and caresses it back past the bowler. Didn't try to hit it hard, just an extension of his stroke. So good to watch
short and well outside the seventh stump on off, easy call for Anil Chaudhary
floats it full and just outside off, left alone
lets it go again
poor ball, strays into the pads and that has been eased past short fine for a boundary. Easy pickings
gets a good stride forward and defends it to midwicket
pads the sweep to short fine, they scoot across for a single
skids onto middle, pushed back to the bowler
driven down to long on for an easy single
slices it into the gap between point and short third man. Not where he intended but doesn't matter. Was beaten in flight as he looked to go over cover, result will please him nonetheless
looks to slap that one past point, cuts back in to beat the inside edge
length ball that nips back in from outside off, left alone
dabbed with soft hands to the off side
angles that one behind the wicket, sent back
width on offer and he climbs onto it. Crashes that behind point
some purchase off the pitch, drifts in and spins away from middle, he gets forward and defends
gets forward and blocks
tucked wide of square leg
waits for it to spin away and plays it towards midwicket, superb stop by Raza
whipped to the fielder at midwicket again

tucked wide of midwicket for a single that wasn't on, Raza ran to his right quickly, ensured a clean one-handed pick-up and throw to the wicketkeeper's end, but Shahzad's just in. A direct hit and he would have been walking back.
uses the pace of the bowler and angles it to point
angled into the pads, flicked wide of mid-on, good running
whips it to the square leg fielder
stands tall and punches it to the off side

that is a cracking delivery. Delivers it at length on off from wide of the crease, Shahzad misjudges the line completely as he prods outside the delivery, nips in a wee bit to sneak through bat and pad as the stumps are disturbed. Shahzad's series is over. The celebration in the Zimbabwe camp says simply why that wicket is so important to them
floats it full on middle, pushed to mid-on
gets it up and over the infield, just past the outstretched hands of Cremer at cover, didn't get to the pitch of it but went through with the stroke
mistimes a cut to point fielder
slow turn from off stump, eased past short third man
waits for the ball to spin away and then wrists it into the gap at deep square leg
eased to third man, pushed forward for a thick edge that rolled along the ground
delicately done, opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
watches the length ball outside off through to the wicketkeeper
excellent stop by Masakadza at gully, it was steered well, would have certainly been at least two had it passed him
gets a thick inside edge, lands short of the midwicket fielder

the frustration of having been denied boundaries has resulted in a rash stroke. Short outside off, he shaped for the cut, threw the kitchen sink at it but only managed a thick edge through to the wicketkeeper, who gleefully accepted that. Mangal was specially brought back in to lend experience to the top order, but the move hasn't worked.
crunched but straight to the cover fielder
crunched but can't pierce the off side ring, straight to point
length ball outside off, drops it into the off side gently and pushes off for a quick single
good delivery. Angles a length ball on off, nips away further, lands short of the wicketkeeper as the batsman plays inside the line and lets it go
nicely behind the line of the ball as he defends it to the off side
slower ball from Jongwe outside off, Noor Ali improvised well though. Did not pick it but turned it towards midwicket
drifts on Shahidi's pads who flicks to midwicket
picks the gap through extra cover. Did not look to hit it too hard but timed it so well that the ball carried to the boundary. Leant into the half-volley and found a boundary
better from Jongwe. Fuller than a good length but the ball shapes away late, Shahidi goes for anohter drive but is beaten
hits the gap again. But the sweeper is back. Fullish again and wide, Shahidi drives

gone! Massive wicket this. Noor Ali goes. A well-directed bouncer on middle, Noor Ali goes for a pull but cannot keep it down. The pull skies up towards the fine leg boundary, and the fielder takes a good catch over his head. Unnecessary shot at this time. Afghanistan suddenly in a bit of trouble.
beauty. Nagging lines from Madziva. Full and shaping away, the poke is beaten
and again. Lovely bowling. Good length but angling away, Shahidi has a naughty flirt at it and is beaten again
shortish but wide, left alone this time
fullish outside off, steered off the outside half of the bat to point
played the line there. Not a bad shot, did not go poking at it. Full and wide - fifth-stump line, shaping away. Swerves past the outside edge
wider outside off, left alone
back of length delivery on off, taps it to the cover region
angled into middle and leg, defended towards square leg
shows the full face of the bat and defends it back down the pitch
bowls that a touch fuller, around off, Nabi is solidly behind the line of that one
once again well forward as he bunts it to cover
helps it down to the fine leg boundary. Erred in length and got punished. All Nabi had to do was get some bat on it, which he did.
looks to fetch the pull from outside off, only ended up dragging it towards mid-on, but lands short of the captain there. It looked like Chigumbura misjudged it for a split second as he went back
gets back and blocks it to the off side
nicely behind the line as he taps that one from middle to the on side
gets on top of the bounce and bunts it to the off side
width on offer, but he can only toe end that drive to mid-off
gets a good stride forward and plays it to the off side
uppish but just wide of the bowler, down to long on
eased to mid-off as they scamper through for a quick single
shaped to pull but the ball kept low, he quickly adjusted to defend
angles it full on middle from wide of the crease, flicked to deep midwicket
punched into the gap at cover, sensible stuff
opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
short and wide outside off, punched off the back foot to sweeper cover
looks to fetch the pull from outside off, nearly chops it back onto the stumps, the bottom edge rolls towards short fine leg

big appeal for lbw. Nabi walks across the stumps to whip it away but misses the length ball that thuds into his pad. The middle and leg stump was visible. Very close call there. Height could have been the only reason. Umpire Shamsuddin was very sure that it would have gone over. Top decision
eased past the infield to deep cover
gets back into the crease and pats it to the off side
full and angling away from outside off, left alone
at length on middle, defended with the full face of the bat
uppish but safe, hit towards sweeper cover
excellent stroke, gets on top of the bounce and steers it wide of point, the third man fielder is extremely alert down there
nips back into middle and leg, tucked to square leg
eased wide of point, quick single taken
cramped for room, worked towards midwicket
poor ball and put away. Makes room and cracks that short ball outside off into the point boundary
slower and fuller on off, pushed to cover
full ball on middle, hint of movement away as well, has the line of the ball well covered
looks to whip it away this time, but is done in by the slowness of the surface, was through with the stroke even before the ball got to him
crunching cover drive, the fielder in the deep does well to rush to the ball and hurl a rocket throw
punched back to the bowler
spins back in from outside off, sneaks through the gap between bat and pad, good take by the keeper who rides the bounce
gets forward and defends
quick single towards midwicket, a misfield made the run into a stroll in the end
too short, he rocks back, makes a bit of room and crunches it into the gap at deep cover, should have been two. Poor running
steps out but can't get to the pitch, turned to square leg
waits for the turn and slaps it towards deep point
tossed up on middle, spins back in a touch, he drives but gets a thick inside edge that rolls back down the pitch
tucked to square leg
on the shorter side, and he says 'thank you very much.' Rocks back, opens his shoulders and helps it past short fine leg. Poor ball, duly punished. Welcome boundary
sharp turn back in from outside off, he's cramped for room, looked to leave initially, but had to change his stroke at the last moment, blocked to the off side
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it to deep cover
trifle short, he cuts but mistimes it, straight to Raza at cover
steps out, takes it on the full and plays it down to long on
walks across and drives it wide of cover for a quick single
stretches forward and turns it wide of square leg for an easy single
steps out, can't get underneath that one, pushed back towards the bowler
pushed through quicker on middle and leg, flicked towards deep square, the call was for two but the fielder did well to rush in quickly to keep it down to a single
nicely tossed up on middle and leg, worked down to long on
slow turn back into middle and leg, nudged wide of the diving square leg fielder, they're playing sensibly here
driven with the spin to long-off
too full but way down leg, he attempts a paddle but misses, keeper stops it with his pad
good flight on that one, lands it on off, he stretches forward to smother the spin
turned wide of square leg for an easy single
confusion, confusion but no damage done in the end. Nabi turned it to midwicket and took off for a non-existent single, both batsmen stopped and were halfway down, somehow managed to complete it
played back to the bowler who fires a throw back to the keeper
milks it wide of square leg for an easy single, nicely done
eased with the spin, back to th ebowler
cover fielder dives over the ball, shouldn't have even been one, but they get two instead. The wicketkeeper makes an angry gesture towards the boundary rider
another misunderstanding, but the misfield at midwicket gives them the single
slides on to rap him on the pad but it pitched outside leg. Stifled appeal, but they knew there was no way that would have been given out
too short, lucky to get away as he toe ends the pull back down the pitch
attempted wrong-un, but it slides across the face of the bat, the back foot was in the air for a brief, but he got it back in quickly
driven to long on
gets forward and turns it to square leg
picks the length early and slaps it wide of deep point, second one easily completed

that is a cracking delivery. Drifts in, slides on after pitching on middle and off, Nabi played all around it and was trapped plumb in front. Cremer doesn't disappoint again. Nabi was looking dangerous, and perhaps for the first time in the series looked in complete control while he was there.
gets back and taps it to point
cramped for room, pushed to cover point

this one's the legspinner, it pitches on off and skids on, Hasmat played for the turn but it was a straight one that came back in to beat the inside edge and hit off stump. Two in two overs, Hasmatullah is gone now and you really have to wonder if that's the game. A dagger through the Afghan hearts
gets forward and blocks
short on middle and leg, punched to deep cover
can't get to the pitch, looked to smash that over cover, gets an inside edge, rolls back to the bowler
waits for the slow turn from middle, dabbed back down the pitch
eased wide of cover for an easy single
sharp turn from well outside off, he rocked back but had to reach out to cut, just managed to get a tiny bit of wood on it

I'm really not sure how that missed the stumps. Stanikzai prodded forward, the googly somehow spun back in sharply, sneaked in through bat, pad but went over the stumps. Beat the keeper too, handy runs nevertheless
lunges forward and smothers the spin
nicely defended again to the off side
looks to cut, but too full, defended to the off side
gets back and offers a dead bat
slides across the surface, pushed to the off side
slices that one to point
tucked with the spin towards square leg
flatter one on middle and leg, eased into the gap between midwicket and square leg
sharp turn from off stump, whizzes past the outside edge, Stanikzai was clueless
gets the bat well in front of the pad as he defends one that turns away from middle and leg
gives it good flight, lands it on leg, he gets forward and smothers the spin
gently defended towards short cover
pushed through quicker on middle, tucked to midwicket, he wanted a single but was sent back
gets a thick edge, short third man swoops in quickly. Maiden over.
walks across and punches it to long on
appeal for lbw but the ball was spinning back in, which may have put a shade of doubt in the umpire's mind. We will have to reconfirm if there was an inside edge
tickled nice and fine towards the man at 45, good running this time
gets forward and taps it to the off side
covers the spin nicely as he nurdles it to the on side
driven towards long off
gets to the pitch and eases it wide of cover
stretches forward and dabs it to the off side
flicks the low full toss to midwicket
slow turn from off stump, eased to the off side, looked like he wanted to have a swipe at that one
gets forward and turns it wide of midwicket as they scamper through for a quick single, he had to dive into the crease to get back, did Gulbadin
full toss on middle, pushed to long on
gets to the pitch of the ball and turns it to long on again
shapes to cut but the ball spins back in sharply, cramped for room in the end, somehow pushes it to point
waits for it to come back in, sharp turn again, defended with soft hands
tucked wide of midwicket
short ball on middle and leg, punched to midwicket
gives it good flight again, lands it on off, he covers the spin and defends
turned to short fine as they scamper through for a quick single, the throw from the fielder at the bowler's end is a good one, except it didn't hit
goes over midwicket, gets enough bat on it. Sees the flight, opens his shoulders and lofts it nice and clean over the fielder there.
wild slog across the line, was held back a little more, sweep and miss
shows the full face and defends it down to long on
gets forward and works it towards square leg
flatter one on middle, slapped back to the bowler
waits for the slow turn, nudged wide of midwicket

shapes to cut but the ball hurries through, Stanikzai was late on the shot, but managed a thin edge as it was too close to his body. Excellent catch by Mutumbami. Stanikzai stood there as if nothing happened, but umpire Anil Chaudhary would have none of it. Raised his finger to send him back on his way. Dagger through the Afghan hearts. The batting thins considerably now
gets forward and covers the spin as he defends
picks the wrong-un, pushed to cover
two point fielders there for the ball that lands short, he eased it well but couldn't pierce the gap
cracking ball. Spins across the face of the bat
doesn't offer a shot, looks to pad one that straightens, but the bounce saved him
hangs back and defends
looks to cut, chops one to the slip fielder
drifts in and spins away from off stump, defended
fails to pick the wrong-un, hit on the thigh pad as he pushes outside the line of the ball
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it to wide long off
hit hard but straight to cover again
had to reach out for it, nicely tossed up, pushed to the off side
pushed through quicker on off, looked to ease it behind the wicket, missed it
driven straight to cover again
slow turn back into middle and leg, ball rolls off the inner half of the bat to the on side

excellent connection this time. Lines him up, had decided he would go down town come hell or high water, it was a little too full and he crunched it off the middle, just over the straight boundary. Afghanistan need more of it
flat one on middle, punched into the deep midwicket region
accurate stuff this time, lands on middle, turns away, pushed to the off side
mistimes a cut, not in control as he hit it in the air, no one at point because there was a boundary rider there
hit well but straight back to the bowler
angled into middle and leg, tapped to square leg
half volley, he extends his arms and crashes that into the gap at deep cover, the fielder just manages to pull it back in. Full marks to Cremer, saved one run for his team. Excellent commitment
quicker one on leg, slips out, batsman misses the tickle, good take
spins back into middle, defended again
nicely behind the line of the ball as he pats it to midwicket
thick inside edge, nearly lobbed to midwicket
slides across the turf, skids on from middle and off, late on the stroke. Beaten
punched to cover
gets a bottom edge to an attempted slog, rolls wide of the bowler to the leg side
quicker one on middle and leg, late on the stroke, hit on the thigh pad
deceived by the googly, pushes outside the line, hit on the pad but it was spinning down leg
slides back in and spins away, doesn't miss the off stump by much as he shapes to cut, beaten
picks the wrong-un this time, played back to the bowler
fires one outside off, almost like he was bowling seam-ups, misses the delicate dab, good take by the wicketkeeper

too much width outside off this time, he has slapped that into the gap at point, even a desperate dive from Chibhabha couldn't prevent the boundary. Excellent timing, even better placement. Too short and it deserved to be punished
another short ball, another cut, this time Chibhabha moves swiftly to stop that
driven to the cover fielder
fired into middle, punched back past te bowler
hit back to the bowler, the pressure is building and the choke is on
looks to swing that into Sheikh Zayed Road, nowhere near it, beaten
slogged down the ground, Raza, at long on, almost got his hands on it, but the leap to take the catch took him backwards as he landed on the ropes; he ball bounced into the boundary skirting.
swung over the infield, straight to deep midwicket this time
shows the full face of the bat, driven down to long off
close shave, chops one but it misses the leg stump. They scoot across for the single
fired down leg, poor start
firm drive towards wide long-off, two was the call but the fielder did very well to get around quickly
punched wide of the bowler to long on
fired into the leg side, eased to deep backward square, there was an overthrow, Rashid was sent back, he had to dive into the crease at the non-striker's end, did well to dish in a full-length dive
fired into middle, eased wide of cover for a quick single
gets a thick edge, straight to short third man
width on offer, helped over point, third man does well
high full toss on middle, swung across the line and he's hit that into the stands at deep midwicket. Teeing off like a golfer in style. Nailed it

flat hit, another one over the ropes. Positioned himself to play that slog even before the bowler delivered. Aiding him was the bowler who pitched it right in the slot, Naib got his left leg out of the way and hammered between deep midwicket and wide long on
full on the pads, flicked towards deep midwicket, Naib slipped and so couldn't take off for the second
hops back and eases that into the gap at deep cover, Rashid wanted the second but was sent back
offers the full face of the bat, played to long on
worked to long on for an easy single
cut away but straight to the fielder, poor ball, lucky to get away
excellent stop off his own bowling, two dots
this time he crunches it into the gap between the two point fielders, but there is third man
squeezed into the gap at wide long off, but will just be one
backs away and drives it inside-out to cover
slashed over point, the boundary rider takes it on the bounce. It was short, and had enough width. Timed well, got the placement wrong
he's picked the bones out of that one. High full toss on middle, he walks across and just flicks it up and over the deep midwicket region. Sailed onto the roof. Half-century as well.
another full toss, another swing, another hit. Another one towards deep midwicket. No chance for the two fielders in the deep. Split the gap perfectly
makes room and squeezes it to Chigumbura at the edge of the circle at cover
over cover point and into the boundary at the rate of knots. Length outside off, Rashid threw his bat at it as hard as possible, screamer!
peach! Back of length on middle, nips away late, Rashid is squared up as he looked to defend
fired into the pads, flicked into the gap at deep midwicket
into the blockhole, squeezed to long on
eased wide of point for a quick single
low full toss on the pads, flicked between deep midwicket and wide long on
spins away from middle, covers the line of the ball, defended back down the pitch
good stop off his followthrough again
length on offer, clears the front leg and slaps that between cover and mid-off, easy pickings
top yorker, tailing back in, he jams is bat down on time, they scoot across for the single
swung across towards square leg, lucky to get away with that low full toss. Naib is disappointed that he missed out
length ball, looked to go over long-off but didn't get enough power behind that one to go over the ropes, ended up chipping it as Graeme Cremer took a straightforward catch. Is there another twist?
squeezed to deep midwicket, another yorker length delivery

looks for the glory hit, swung across the line in his quest to go over midwicket, only connected with the humid air as the ball cannoned into the stumps. Poor application, but that's what pressure can do to you. Afghanistan camp looks stunned.
fires a full toss outside off, he swings and misses, keeper fails to connect, four byes. Does it really matter how the runs come?
cut but straight to point
swing and a miss. Looked to go over cover, didn't get to the pitch. Half-stop by the keeper
gets a thick edge to short third man
angles it back from wide of the crease, dabbed behind point for a quick single
walks across the stumps and turns it round the corner for an easy single, sensible stuff. Will keep strike
carved over cover, the man in the deep gets around quickly but can't prevent the second
loses his shape, pressure telling on him. Bowls it far too wide outside off, looked like the ball slipped out of his hand
swings north, ball goes south. The ball flies off the thick edge into the vacant third man boundary. Not where he intended, but it doesn't matter

squeezed down to long-on, not hit well, so they come back for the second as the fielder had to rush in to get to the ball. Naib thinks they've scored the winning runs and takes his helmet off and nearly runs a lap around the ground, only to be later told by the umpire that they still have one run to get

half volley on the pads and he's flicked that up and over the deep backward square leg boundary. Way over the ropes. The entire Afghanistan team is out in the middle as Naib is hoisted on the shoulders of Nabi. The Afghanistan flag flutters high in the night sky. The fans are dancing. What a knock, what a finish!
